section.title: Overview
section.para: This is a module which provides a UNIX/UDP SOCKET transport layer implementation for the Management Interface.

section.title: DATAGRAM command syntax
section.para:
The external commands issued via DATAGRAM interface must follow the following syntax:
request = first_line (argument '\n')*
first_line = ':'command_name':''\n'
argument = (arg_name '::' (arg_value)? ) | (arg_value)
arg_name = not-quoted_string
arg_value = not-quoted_string | '"' string '"'
not-quoted_string = string - {',",\n,\r}

section.title: socket_name (string)
section.para: The name of a UNIX SOCKET or an IP address. The UNIX datagram or UDP socket will be created using this parameter in order to read the external commands. Both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported.

section.title: children_count (string)
section.para: The number of child processes to be created. Each child process will be a datagram server.

section.title: unix_socket_mode (integer)
section.para: Permission to be used for creating the listening UNIX datagram socket. Not necessary for a UDP socket. It follows the UNIX conventions.

section.title: unix_socket_group (integer) unix_socket_group (string)
section.para: Group to be used for creating the listening UNIX socket.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: unix_socket_user (integer) unix_socket_group (string)
section.para: User to be used for creating the listening UNIX socket.

para.emphasis: Default value is the inherited one.

section.title: socket_timeout (integer)
section.para: The reply will expire after trying to sent it for socket_timeout miliseconds.

section.title: reply_indent (string)
section.para: Strings to be used for line indentation. As the MI data structure is tree oriendeted, the depth level will printed as identation.
